hc.server.ui

Class CtrlResponse

  • java.lang.Object
    • hc.server.ui.CtrlResponse

  • public abstract class CtrlResponse
extends Object
    CtrlResponse is used to design a remote controller.

    if you want design a powerful controller with complex UI, see HTMLMlet or Mlet
    Since:
    6.98

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      abstract void click(int key)
      it is invoked when user click some key of remote controller.
      String getButtonInitText(int key)
      set initial text for some key.

      this method is invoked by HomeCenter server to initialize the button text of controller.
      String getElementID()
      the elementID of current CtrlResponse.
      ProjectContext getProjectContext()
      return current project context
      String getTarget()
      for example, return controller://myctrl
      void onExit()
      it is invoked by server when exit this controller.
      void onLoad()
      it is invoked by server when enter this controller.
      void sendMovingMsg(String msg)
      send a message moving from right to left.

      Note : if mobile is in background (ProjectContext.isMobileInBackground()), a notification is also created for mobile.

      if mobile option [Message, Notification to Speech also] is on, it may be spoken.
      the speech or not is depends on text, TTS engine, locale and mute of mobile.
      void sendStatus(String[] attributes, String[] status)
      send a group status of controller to mobile.
      void sendStatus(String[] attributes, String[] status, boolean isRTL)
      send a group status of controller to mobile.
      void sendStatus(String attribute, String status)
      send status of controller to mobile
      void sendStatus(String attribute, String status, boolean isRTL)
      send status of controller to mobile
      void setButtonText(int key, String text)
      notify controller of mobile to change text of a button.
      void showTip(String msg)
      display a message moving from right to left on mobile

      Note : if mobile is in background (ProjectContext.isMobileInBackground()), a notification is also created for mobile.

    • Method Detail

      • click

        public abstract void click(int key)
        it is invoked when user click some key of remote controller.
        Parameters:
        key - see CtrlKey
        Since:
        6.98

      • getButtonInitText

        public String getButtonInitText(int key)
        set initial text for some key.

        this method is invoked by HomeCenter server to initialize the button text of controller.
        If you don't want to set button text, please don't override this method or return null(or empty string) for keyValue in the implementation.
        Parameters:
        key - see CtrlKey
        Returns:
        the initial button text of key
        Since:
        6.98

      • getElementID

        public String getElementID()
        the elementID of current CtrlResponse.

        for example, current CtrlResponse is "controller://MyCtrler", then the elementID is "MyCtrler".

        to get the instance of menu item for current CtrlResponse in designer, invoke ProjectContext.getMenuItemBy(String, String).
        Returns:
        Since:
        7.20
        See Also:
        ProjectContext.getMenuItemBy(String, String)

      • getProjectContext

        public ProjectContext getProjectContext()
        return current project context
        Returns:
        Since:
        6.98

      • getTarget

        public String getTarget()
        for example, return controller://myctrl
        Returns:
        Since:
        6.98

      • onExit

        public void onExit()
        it is invoked by server when exit this controller.
        Since:
        6.98

      • onLoad

        public void onLoad()
        it is invoked by server when enter this controller.
        Since:
        6.98

      • sendMovingMsg

        public void sendMovingMsg(String msg)
        send a message moving from right to left.

        Note : if mobile is in background (ProjectContext.isMobileInBackground()), a notification is also created for mobile.

        if mobile option [Message, Notification to Speech also] is on, it may be spoken.
        the speech or not is depends on text, TTS engine, locale and mute of mobile.
        Parameters:
        msg - the message to show.
        Since:
        7.30
        See Also:
        ProjectContext.sendMovingMsg(String)

      • sendStatus

        public void sendStatus(String[] attributes,
              String[] status)
        send a group status of controller to mobile.
        Parameters:
        attributes -
        status -
        Since:
        6.98

      • sendStatus

              String[] status,
              boolean isRTL)
        send a group status of controller to mobile.
        Parameters:
        attributes -
        status -
        isRTL - true if is right to left
        Since:
        6.98

        Since:

      • showTip

        public void showTip(String msg)
        display a message moving from right to left on mobile

        Note : if mobile is in background (ProjectContext.isMobileInBackground()), a notification is also created for mobile.

        if mobile option [Message, Notification to Speech also] is on, it may be spoken.
        the speech or not is depends on text, TTS engine, locale and mute of mobile.
        Parameters:
        msg - the message to show.
        Since:
        6.98
        See Also:
        ProjectContext.sendMovingMsg(String)
